etymologies: mid 16th century: translating Greek tragopōgon or Latin Barba Capri

definitions: a plant of the daisy family, with slender grasslike leaves, yellow flowers that typically close at about midday, and downy fruits that resemble those of a dandelion. Native to Eurasia, it has become established in eastern North America.
a plant of the rose family, with long plumes of white flowers, found in both Eurasia and North America.
shortDefinitions: plant of rose family, with long plumes of white flowers
